citeinfo.origin: Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission (FWC), Fish and Wildlife Research Institute (FWRI), Center for Spatial Analysis
citeinfo.title: Florida Statewide Nearshore Bathymetry

descript.abstract: This data set includes the nearshore bathymetry of the state of Florida as lines representing bathymetric contours. These data are a statewide compilation of the Fish and Wildlife Research Institute's regional nearshore bathymetry contours. Geonex digitized the contours during 1991-1992 from clean, wrinkle-free paper National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) nautical charts. Geonex used the most current versions of the charts available at that time. The source charts used to create this data set varied in scale from 1:10000 to 1:80000, but in all cases, the largest scale charts available were used. Geonex staff members also interpolated additional contours not present on the charts.
descript.purpose: This data set was created to represent marine depth contours and depth range polygons, primarily for cartographic purposes.
descript.supplinf: Prior to July 1, 2004, the Fish and Wildlife Research Institute (FWRI) was known as the Florida Marine Research Institute (FMRI). The institute name has not been changed in historical data sets or references to work completed by the Florida Marine Research Institute. The institute name has been changed in references to ongoing research, new research, and contact information. These data may contain attribute and positional inaccuracies. These data were compiled from the original 1992 coverages; they do not reflect any positional or attribute edits that have been made individually to the regional data sets. These data are not to be used for navigation. User should be aware that later versions of the source charts may be available and that contours may have changed. Consult the appropriate coast pilot and the most recent paper or digital charts available. (previous geoform was 'vector digital data')

place.placekey: St. Johns River Water Management District

idinfo.accconst: All data must be verified by Principal Investigator or Group Database Analyst prior to release. It is strongly recommended that this data is directly acquired from FWC and not indirectly through other sources which may have changed the data in some way. FWC makes no claims as to the data's suitability for other purposes.
idinfo.useconst: FWC-FWRI and the originator of the data must be credited. This is not a survey data set and should not be utilized as such. These data are not to be used for navigation. Acknowledgement of the FWC-FWRI (Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission-Fish and Wildlife Research Institute) as the data source would be appreciated in any products developed from these data, and such acknowledgment as is standard for citation and legal practices for data source is expected by users of this data. Please cite the original metadata when using portions of the record to create a similar record of slightly altered data, such as reprojection. If any data are modified or adjusted, please share the edited information with FWC. Users should be aware that comparison with other data sets for the same area from other time periods may be inaccurate due to inconsistencies resulting from changes in mapping conventions, data collection, and computer processes over time. FWC shall not be liable for improper or incorrect use of this data. These data are not legal documents and are not to be used as such. This is not a survey data set and should not be utilized as such. These data are not to be used for navigation.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 2000 Version 5.0 (Build 2195) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcCatalog 8.1.0.642

attracc.attraccr: All entities and attributes have been identified and documented. FWRI has not verified attribute accuracy.

dataqual.logic: Most of the data are logically consistent. However, some lines are coded as 666, indicating that they are inland water bodies. This attribute should be for polygons only, because a line around an inland water body should have a depth of 0. However, not all of the arcs coded as DEPTH = 666 are indeed shoreline. This data set does not contain a shoreline. This data set needs additional quality checks and editing.
dataqual.complete: Most of the data are logically consistent. However, some lines are coded as 666, indicating that they are inland water bodies. This attribute should be for polygons only, because a line around an inland water body should have a depth of 0. However, not all of the arcs coded as DEPTH = 666 are indeed shoreline. This data set does not contain a shoreline. This data set needs additional quality checks and editing.

horizpa.horizpar: Positional accuracy has not been verified by FWRI. Not all contours match the source charts. Some contours may have been interpolated from other sources. FWRI has not verified that all contours deviating from the source charts are interpolations.

citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, National Ocean Service
citeinfo.title: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration Nautical Charts - various

srcinfo.srccontr: Geonex digitized the nearshore contours from the largest scale charts available.

procstep.procdesc: Geonex digitized the nearshore contours from clean, wrinkle-free paper National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) nautical charts. Geonex used the most current versions of the charts available at that time. The source charts used to create this data set varied in scale from 1:10000 to 1:80000, but in all cases, the largest scale charts available were used. In some areas, Geonex staff members interpolated additional contours not present on the charts. GEONEX gave these data to FWRI as regional coverages. FWRI appended these coverages in ArcInfo to make the statewide data set.

cntinfo.cntinst: Avineon was formerly called Agra Baymont, which was previously GEONEX.

procstep.procdesc: FWRI imported the coverage into SDE.

cntperp.cntorg: FWC-FWRI (Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission-Fish and Wildlife Research Institute)

cntaddr.address: Fish and Wildlife Research Institute 100 Eighth Avenue Southeast

enttyp.enttypd: This data set represents bathymetry contours in arc format.

attr.attrdef: This field indicates the depth (in feet) of the shallowest contour represented by the line. In cases where a non-depth item is represented, a special 3-digit number is used to describe the feature. The following values can be found in this data set: 3 = 3 feet 6 = 6 feet 12 = 12 feet 18 = 18 feet 30 = 30 feet 60 = 60 feet 100 = 100 feet 555 = exposed at mean lower low water 777 = dredged channel 666 = these arcs may be improperly coded as inland water body shoreline 888 = spoil 889 = frequently changing 999 = chart border

attrdomv.udom: This field indicates the depth (in feet) of the shallowest contour represented by the line. In cases where a non-depth item is represented, a special 3-digit number is used to describe the feature. The following values can be found in this data set: 3 = 3 feet 6 = 6 feet 12 = 12 feet 18 = 18 feet 30 = 30 feet 60 = 60 feet 100 = 100 feet 555 = exposed at mean lower low water 777 = dredged channel 666 = these arcs may be improperly coded as inland water body shoreline 888 = spoil 889 = frequently changing 999 = chart border
Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Length of arc (in meters); SDE automatically calculates

attrdomv.udom: Length of arc (in meters); SDE automatically calculates

attr.attrdef: Textual description of DEPTH attribute value

attrdomv.udom: Textual description of DEPTH attribute value

overview.eaover: Each line contour contains the attribute DEPTH, which represents the shallowest contour depth in feet. Special non-depth items are indicated by 3-digit codes.
overview.eadetcit: Each line contour contains the attribute DEPTH, which represents the shallowest contour depth in feet. Special non-depth items are indicated by 3-digit codes.

The user assumes all responsibility for the accuracy and suitability of this data set for a specific application. In no event will the staff of the Fish and Wildlife Research Institute be liable for any damages, including lost profits, lost savings, or other incidental or consequential damages arising from the use of or the inability to use this data set.

stdorder.fees: None. However, persons or organizations requesting information must provide transfer media if FTP is not available and must pay express shipping costs if express shipping is required.
stdorder.ordering: Contact GIS Librarian by e-mail, telephone, or letter explaining which products are needed and providing a brief description of how the products will be used. Also, provide name and address of the person or organization requesting the products.
stdorder.turnarnd: Usually within 10 business days, although, complex requests may take longer

distinfo.custom: These data have caveats. Contact GIS Librarian for details. If these data are maintained by an agency other than FWC-FWRI, then the source agency should be contacted directly for requests.
